snippet: Sears’s first-quarter loss narrowed but sales continue to slump as it prepares the introduction of its real estate investment trust this week to raise cash.
abstract: Sears Holdings reports loss of $303 million, or $2.85 per share, in first-quarter, down from loss of $402 million in period year earlier; Sears is forming Seritage Growth Properties, real estate investment trust, and is planning to sell around 235 properties and lease them back.
lead_paragraph: Sears’s first-quarter loss narrowed but sales continue to slump as it prepares the introduction of its real estate investment trust this week to raise cash.

headline.main: Sears Is Under Pressure as Rollout of REIT Nears
headline.print_headline: Sears Is Under Pressure as Rollout of REIT Nears
